title: Government move surprised me, But I’m ready: Mahinda Rajapaksa
byline: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa said in a popular television programme that the current government seeks revenge not only against the Rajapaksas but also against anyone perceived as a threat. ‘That is not a problem for us,’ he added.

title: Bus crews on coastal line still using drugs, Gemunu says
byline: Lanka Private Bus Owners’ Association (LPBOA) President Gemunu Wijeratne has alleged that not only drivers but also conductors are still using drugs while on duty, particularly along the coastal line.

title: Rare ladybird recorded in the UK for the first time
byline: A ’’new’’ ladybird species has been recorded in the UK for the first time following the hot weather over the summer.

title: Gemunu warns of potential islandwide bus strike over Government policies on buses
byline: The Lanka Private Bus Owners’ Association (LPBOA) has expressed strong criticism of the current government, accusing it of taking “continuous revenge” against private bus operators. LPBOA Chairman Gemunu Wijerathne said there is growing anger within the industry over the government’s policies.

title: Lack of evidence leads to acquittal in Swiss national murder
byline: The Tangalle High Court acquitted an accused in the murder case of Swiss national Hans Radeloff, who was found dead at his home in Seenimodara in 2004.

title: Boxing champion Ricky Hatton dies aged 46
byline: British boxing legend Ricky Hatton has died aged 46, just weeks after announcing his return to the ring.

title: All leaders must unite to safeguard country’s future: Vajira Abeywardane
byline: Former MP Vajira Abeywardane has urged all political leaders in Sri Lanka to come together on one stage to safeguard the country’s future and prevent the younger generation from being misled.

title: 5.8 Earthquake Jolts Assam’s Guwahati, Tremors Felt In North Bengal, Bhutan
byline: A 5.8 magnitude earthquake jolted Assam’s Guwahati at 4:41 pm, with tremors felt as far as North Bengal and neighbouring Bhutan. Its epicentre was in Udalguri district, the officials said. The depth of the quake was 5 km.

title: School disaster risk index launched to strengthen resilience
byline: The Disaster Management Centre (DMC), in collaboration with the Ministry of Education, has released the first version of the School Disaster Risk Index, a comprehensive tool designed to strengthen resilience in Sri Lanka’s education sector.

title: President to leave US and Japan
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake will leave for the United States on 22 September to attend the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA).

title: Airport security officer arrested for attempted gold smuggling
byline: A Security Officer at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) was arrested by airport customs officers on Sunday morning for attempting to smuggle gold biscuits worth Rs. 215 million.

title: No handshakes as India beat Pakistan in Asia Cup T20
byline: India beat Pakistan by seven wickets in the Asia Cup on Sunday as the neighbours met for the first time since a military conflict between them in May, but tensions simmered after the match as India’s players left the field without shaking hands.

title: Strong Sri Lanka face struggling Hong Kong in Asia Cup 2025
byline: Sri Lanka will look to build on their perfect start in Asia Cup when they take on a struggling Hong Kong in Dubai on Monday.

title: Woman arrested for defacing Sigiriya’s historic Mirror Wall
byline: A 21-year-old woman was arrested yesterda for allegedly defacing the historic Mirror Wall at the Sigiriya Rock Fortress by writing her name on it.

title: Adolescence triumphs at the Emmys while The Studio breaks records
byline: Netflix’s breakout drama Adolescence has triumphed at this year’s Emmys, winning six awards.

title: Controversy surrounds appointment of Ganeshanathan as Dy. High Commissioner in Chennai
byline: The recent appointment of Kedeeshwaran Ganeshanathan, a supporter of the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP), as Sri Lanka’s Deputy High Commissioner to Chennai has sparked significant concern among diplomatic circles and within the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

title: High Post Committee to probe Ravi Seneviratne
byline: The High Post Committee of Parliament has decided to summon Public Security Ministry Secretary Ravi Seneviratne for an inquiry into legal cases pending against him.

title: Online sex trade intensifies in Sri Lanka
byline: Police have intensified attention to address the rapid rise of online prostitution platforms, amid growing concerns over cyber fraud, exploitation, and the involvement of vulnerable individuals, including minors. It was revealed that several tourists on tourist visas are engaging in such activities, further raising alarm, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: August tourism earnings fall to US$ 259mn despite higher arrivals
byline: Sri Lanka’s tourism earnings fell to US$ 258.9 million this August, an 8.2 percent decrease compared to the same month last year. This decline occurred despite a significant 20.4 percent year-on-year increase in tourist arrivals.

title: Boxing champion Ricky Hatton dies aged 46
byline: British boxing legend Ricky Hatton has died aged 46, just weeks after announcing his return to the ring.

title: HDA officer arrested in Pitigala over Rs. 50,000 bribe
byline: A Housing Development Authority (HDA) technical officer was arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) for allegedly accepting a bribe of Rs. 50,000 in Pitigala

title: “I don’t arrange people to visit me” – Maithripala
byline: Referring to the large crowd that gathered to see former President Mahinda Rajapaksa as he was leaving his Carlton House residence, former President Maithripala Sirisena said he does not bring people.

title: Sunil Watagala denies allegations of purchasing luxury residence
byline: Deputy Minister of Public Security Sunil Watagala denied allegations circulating on social media that he had purchased a luxury residence at the Cinnamon Life complex.

title: Rasamanickam raises concern over Mylathamadu Farmers’ protest
byline: Illankai Tamil Arasu Kachchi (ITAK) Parliamentarian Shanakiyan Rasamanickam has expressed concern over the continuing farmers’ protest in Mylathamadu, Batticaloa, which entered its second year today.

title: Another suspected ICE production factory uncovered in Hambantota
byline: Another suspected crystal methamphetamine (ICE) production factory operating from an apartment complex in Hambantota, has been discovered by the Kalutara Crimes Investigations Division.

title: Plans afoot to set up 50 multimodal transport centres by 2029
byline: The government aims to establish at least 50 multimodal transport centres across the country by 2029, Transport Minister Bimal Rathnayake announced today.

title: Rs. 2,000 note gradually enters circulation: CBSL
byline: The Rs. 2,000 commemorative currency note, issued recently, will be gradually released into circulation through licensed commercial banks, the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) said.

title: Rising seas will threaten 1.5 million Australians by 2050
byline: One and a half million Australians living in coastal areas are at risk from rising sea levels by 2050, a landmark climate report has warned.

title: Scared to answer even an urgent call of nature under the present Govt: SJB member
byline: A person will be scared to answer even an urgent call of nature outdoors under the present regime as legal action could be taken against him for environmental pollution, Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) Executive Committee Member Mahesh Senanayake said.

title: PCB breaks silence on ’no handshake’ controversy, lodges protest against India
byline: Pakistan filed an official complaint after India, led by Suryakumar Yadav, refused post-match handshakes. PCB called this against the spirit of sports.

title: Rauff Hakeem criticises Government over stance on Israel–Qatar attack
byline: Sri Lanka Muslim Congress (SLMC) Leader, MP Rauff Hakeem, has criticised the government over its recent statement regarding Israel’s attack on Qatar, linked to the ongoing conflict with Palestine.

title: Renovation of Pettah Central Bus stand begins
byline: The renovation of the Pettah Central Bus Stand has officially commenced under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Politician not bound by feelings with people can never become peoples’ leader: MR
byline: A politician who is not bound by feelings with the people can never become a peoples’ leader, former President Mahinda Rajapaksa said today.

title: Poacher dies after gun misfires in waist
byline: A 33-year-old poacher from Radaniara in Walasmulla died yesterday morning after a gun he was carrying in his waist accidentally misfired while he was riding a bicycle.

title: Namal denies allegations over drug containers
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP Namal Rajapaksa, responding to media questions today, condemned reports regarding two containers of raw materials allegedly intended for the production of “ICE” (Crystal Methamphetamine), which had left the port after being detected by the security forces.

title: Education Minister explains delay in issuing interim circular on school admissions
byline: The interim circular on the admission of children was issued late because the Ministry was working to resolve multiple issues while formulating the new policy, with the aim of minimising pressure on the children, Education Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya said.

title: More time for budget debate this time: Bimal
byline: It has been decided to allocate more time for the budget debate especially during the committee stage, Leader of the House Bimal Ratnayake said today.

title: CSE slumps over 250 points as banking counters weigh heavily
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) ended sharply lower on Monday, extending its negative run and delivering a weak start to the week. The ASPI fell 257.01 points (-1.25%) to close at 20,355.39, while the S&P SL20 declined 74.28 points (-1.26%) to 5,798.84.

title: Expert committee’s report on BYD due within next few weeks: AG informs Court
byline: The Attorney General today informed the Court of Appeal that the expert committee’s report on the engine capacity of BYD vehicles is expected within the next few weeks.

title: PUCSL calls for public consultation on proposed 3rd electricity tariff revision
byline: The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) has announced a public consultation on the proposed third electricity tariff revision for the fourth quarter of 2025, submitted by the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB).

title: Magampura Port Management Company defaults USD 18.82 mn to private bank
byline: The Magampura Port Management Company has failed to settle US dollars 18.82 million (Rs. 6,836 million) out of the US dollar 24 million loan obtained from a private bank under a Corporate Guarantee of the Sri Lanka Ports Authority (SLPA), a Parliamentary Committee reveals.

title: Plans to modernise Maradana Railway Station
byline: Plans are afoot to modernise the Maradana Railway Station in a manner that preserves its historical and architectural heritage, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: Time for Opposition in Parliament being curtailed: Sajith
byline: Time allocated in Parliament for the Opposition to raise real issues faced by the people is being curtailed, Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa alleged today.

title: Sampath Manamperi announces plan to surrender before court
byline: Sampath Manamperi, who is wanted in connection with the discovery of two containers of chemicals suspected to be used in the manufacture of the drug “Ice” in the Middeniya area, today informed the Court of Appeal through his lawyer that he intends to surrender before the Magistrate’s Court.

title: PCB threatens Asia Cup pullout over referee handshake row
byline: The board accuses referee Andy Pycroft of neglecting duties as India-Pakistan handshake row sparks major tournament dispute
